meanings.definition: To cut off or remove the side shoots or branches from (a tree or shrub).
meanings.sent1: I saw my neighbor snedding the overgrown bushes in his garden.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will sned the tree to help it grow better.
meanings.sent3: The snedding of the branches turned the messy garden into a neat paradise.
meanings.sent4: She snedded away the unnecessary distractions to focus on her goals.
meanings.sent5: The sound of snedding branches filled the air with the promise of a fresh start.

meanings.sent1: After the storm, the snedding of broken branches was a big task for the cleanup crew.
meanings.sent2: The snedding of the tree limbs revealed a clearer view of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The snedding of the shrubs seemed like a dance of nature's own making.
meanings.sent4: The snedding of old memories brought a sense of renewal to her heart.
meanings.sent5: The snedding of the overgrown plants was a satisfying sight for the tired gardener.
